p: Remdesivir, an investigational monophosphoramidate prodrug of an adenosine analog, was developed between 2014 and 2016 in response to Ebola ( Tchesnokov et al., 2019). Similar to its promising effect on SARS-CoV-1 and MERS-CoV, remdesivir has displayed potent in vitro activity against SARS-CoV-2 by acting as an RNA chain terminator by binding to the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp) ( Wang et al., 2020a). Although, two recent clinical trials have showed that remdesivir was not associated with dramatic clinical improvement, many clinical trials are underway ( Beigel et al., 2020; Wang et al., 2020c).
